verses.text: Moreover the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came to me, saying ,

Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem , saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; I remember thee, the kindness of thy youth , the love of thine espousals , when thou wentest after me in the wilderness , in a land \add that was\add* not sown.\f + \fr 2.2 \ft thee: or, for thy sake\f*

Israel \add was\add* holiness unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add and\add* the firstfruits of his increase : all that devour him shall offend ; evil shall come upon them, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
Hear ye the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, O house of Jacob , and all the families of the house of Israel : \p
¶ Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, What iniquity have your fathers found in me, that they are gone far from me, and have walked after vanity , and are become vain ?

Neither said they, Where \add is\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that brought us up out of the land of Egypt , that led us through the wilderness , through a land of deserts and of pits , through a land of drought , and of the shadow of death , through a land that no man passed through , and where no man dwelt ?

And I brought you into a plentiful country , to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered , ye defiled my land , and made mine heritage an abomination.\f + \fr 2.7 \ft a plentiful…: or, the land of Carmel\f*

The priests said not, Where \add is\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal , and walked after \add things that\add* do not profit. \p
¶ Wherefore I will yet plead with you, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and with your children’s children will I plead.
For pass over the isles of Chittim , and see ; and send unto Kedar , and consider diligently , and see if there be such a thing.\f + \fr 2.10 \ft over: or, over to\f*
Hath a nation changed \add their\add* gods , which \add are\add* yet no gods ? but my people have changed their glory for \add that which\add* doth not profit.
Be astonished , O ye heavens , at this, and be horribly afraid , be ye very desolate , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
For my people have committed two evils ; they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters , \add and\add* hewed them out cisterns , broken cisterns , that can hold no water. \p
¶ \add Is\add* Israel a servant ? \add is\add* he a homeborn \add slave\add*? why is he spoiled ?\f + \fr 2.14 \ft spoiled: Heb. become a spoil?\f*
The young lions roared upon him, \add and\add* yelled , and they made his land waste : his cities are burned without inhabitant.\f + \fr 2.15 \ft yelled: Heb. gave out their voice\f*
Also the children of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.\f + \fr 2.16 \ft have…: or, feed on thy crown\f*
Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God , when he led thee by the way ?
And now what hast thou to do in the way of Egypt , to drink the waters of Sihor ? or what hast thou to do in the way of Assyria , to drink the waters of the river ?

Thine own wickedness shall correct thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee: know therefore and see that \add it is\add* an evil \add thing\add* and bitter , that thou hast forsaken the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God , and that my fear \add is\add* not in thee, saith the Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d* of hosts. \p

¶ For of old time I have broken thy yoke , \add and\add* burst thy bands ; and thou saidst , I will not transgress ; when upon every high hill and under every green tree thou wanderest , playing the harlot.\f + \fr 2.20 \ft transgress: or, serve\f*
Yet I had planted thee a noble vine , wholly a right seed : how then art thou turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine unto me?
For though thou wash thee with nitre , and take thee much soap , \add yet\add* thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*.

How canst thou say , I am not polluted , I have not gone after Baalim ? see thy way in the valley , know what thou hast done : \add thou art\add* a swift dromedary traversing her ways ;\f + \fr 2.23 \ft thou art…: or, O swift dromedary\f*

A wild ass used to the wilderness , \add that\add* snuffeth up the wind at her pleasure ; in her occasion who can turn her away ? all they that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.\f + \fr 2.24 \ft A wild…: or, O wild ass, etc\f*\f + \fr 2.24 \ft used: Heb. taught\f*\f + \fr 2.24 \ft her pleasure: Heb. the desire of her heart\f*\f + \fr 2.24 \ft turn…: or, reverse it?\f*

Withhold thy foot from being unshod , and thy throat from thirst : but thou saidst , There is no hope : no; for I have loved strangers , and after them will I go.\f + \fr 2.25 \ft There…: or, Is the case desperate?\f*
As the thief is ashamed when he is found , so is the house of Israel ashamed ; they, their kings , their princes , and their priests , and their prophets ,

Saying to a stock , Thou \add art\add* my father ; and to a stone , Thou hast brought me forth : for they have turned \add their\add* back unto me, and not \add their\add* face : but in the time of their trouble they will say , Arise , and save us.\f + \fr 2.27 \ft brought…: or, begotten me\f*\f + \fr 2.27 \ft their back: Heb. the hinder part of the neck\f*

But where \add are\add* thy gods that thou hast made thee? let them arise , if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble : for \add according to\add* the number of thy cities are thy gods , O Judah.\f + \fr 2.28 \ft trouble: Heb. evil\f* \p
Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
In vain have I smitten your children ; they received no correction : your own sword hath devoured your prophets , like a destroying lion. \p

¶ O generation , see ye the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel ? a land of darkness ? wherefore say my people , We are lords ; we will come no more unto thee?\f + \fr 2.31 \ft We are…: Heb. We have dominion\f*
Can a maid forget her ornaments , \add or\add* a bride her attire ? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
Why trimmest thou thy way to seek love ? therefore hast thou also taught the wicked ones thy ways.
Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents : I have not found it by secret search , but upon all these.\f + \fr 2.34 \ft secret…: Heb. digging\f*
Yet thou sayest , Because I am innocent , surely his anger shall turn from me. Behold, I will plead with thee, because thou sayest , I have not sinned.
Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way ? thou also shalt be ashamed of Egypt , as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.
Yea, thou shalt go forth from him, and thine hands upon thine head : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath rejected thy confidences , and thou shalt not prosper in them.
